babble.net

Class Response

  • java.lang.Object
    • babble.net.NetworkBuffer
      • babble.net.Response
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HttpResponse, JSONResponse

    public abstract class Response
extends NetworkBuffer
implements Serializable
    A response at network level is simply an array of bytes.
    This facility sends the bytes over a network channel (and buffers them for efficiency). This facility is not aware of ordering of the bytes or their semantics, a protocol-specific response writes the bytes in order of their meaning as per a particular protocol specification.

    This operation buffers the bytes and flushes the internal buffer when it fills up. The flush may fail if this response is not associated with a writable channel.

    A response is implicitly associated at construction with the same network channel of the request that originated it. Hence, by default, the response is written to the same network channel of an incoming request. However, a protocol may require that response is written to a network channel different than that of the request. In such case, the protocol must set a channel before write operations.

    Writing different data types:

    • Multi-Byte Data: multi-byte data such as an integer or long value can be wriiten. The facility accounts for network byte order (e.g BIG or LITTLE endian).
    • String: Strings are written as array of bytes using the encoding scheme set by the user. The default encoding scheme the default encoding scheme of the Java Virtual Machine.
    • Stream: data form a resource path or other stream can be streamed.
    This facility can also pipe the data from another resource.
    Author:
    pinaki poddar
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • send

        protected abstract void send(ByteChannel channel)
                      throws IOException
        Sends the data over a channel. The protocol will set channel, invoke one or more write operations and then call this method to complete sending the response over channel.
        Parameters:
        channel - a communication channel.
        Throws:
        IOException
